ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 1112
ygData.msgSnippet: some people do get into eq through a friend and thay do power lvl them. I seen a 65 cleric with epic who couldnt cast before oom. most the time however power
ygData.messageBody:
some people do get into eq through a friend and thay do power lvl
them. I seen a 65 cleric with epic who couldnt cast before oom. most
the time however power lvling is done by experanced players. I have a
friend who plays to about lvl 30 before deleting and starting
another, he enjoys going from lvl 1 to lvl 30 in a day. It took all
i could do to make him play one to 65. Dont get ripped on power
lvling. When you have a lvl 70 with everything under the sun, I
doubt you will want to sit lfg for 9 hours with a lvl 25 necro. Iam
know lvl 51 and still see very few groups as the servers have fewer
people on. As far as doing it naked its all about where you go and
skill in doing it, have done it a few times and i know how. I think
you may enjoy a druid so you will have the power to group power lvl
and solo.


--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Steven R. Hulse" <steveh@m...>
wrote:
> Hey Shadow,
> First of all my apologis, I wasn't flaming you or anything.
It did
> sound that way huh? It's cool you were able to get PL'd by a player
who
> was willing to sit that long and do it for nothing in return. That
is
> VERY rare. I will admit that I am a little sceptical about the
being
> naked part, you had to have some sort of decent armor on. But again
> thats just me, It may actually be possible to do it "naked".
> I guess the biggest concern with PL'ing for me is if you are
PL'd solo
> you don't gain that "group experience". What I mean there is not
actual
> experience points but how to function in a group. I've had groups
where
> I've been with PL'd newbs that would just wrecklessly pull at thier
whim
> (cause thats all they know how to do) and end up nearly killing the
> entire group because they wouldn't respect the puller or the group
and
> want that "high" from geting all that exp so fast. Im refering to
the
> rush one gets from being PL'd solo and then seeing how fast they
level
> vs. the speed they level at while in a group. It's a much different
> feeling.
>
> Durgaa
>
> EverQuest@yahoogroups.com wrote:
>

on

by

still

and

solo.
